Description: Shoulder fragment (with part of rim and of one handle) of North Ionian Late Wild Goat pottery column-krater; interior reserved; exterior, white slip: handle zone and neck glazed; in panel, tongue frieze above band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Joins Oxford 1912.34, and certainly also from the same vase as other fragment with same number. Compare Walter-Karydi 1973, pl. 118, no. 968.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.292)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
